get.description:

endpoint.

schema.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: Start Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the earliest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: end_time

schema.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.
schema.title: End Time

parameters.description: Timestamp of the latest query to aggregate. Format is `YYYY-MM-DD hh:mm:ss`.

parameters.name: models

schema.description: Models to fetch metrics from. The list must be a set of comma-sparated strings. i.e. `gpt-3.5-turbo,gpt-4o`

schema.description: Secondary user id. The secondary user id will match any string previously sent in the `user` attribute of `/chat/completions`.

put.description:
Creates a custom endpoint. This endpoint must support the OpenAI `/chat/completions`
format. To query your custom endpoint, replace your endpoint string with `<name>@custom`
when querying the unified API.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Alias for the custom endpoint. This will be the name used to call the endpoint.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Alias for the custom endpoint. This will be the name used to call the endpoint.

parameters.name: url

schema.description: Base URL of the endpoint being called. Must support the OpenAI format.
schema.title: Url

parameters.description: Base URL of the endpoint being called. Must support the OpenAI format.

parameters.name: key_name

schema.description: Name of the API key that will be passed as part of the query.
schema.title: Key Name

parameters.description: Name of the API key that will be passed as part of the query.

parameters.name: mdl_name

schema.description: Named passed to the custom endpoint as model name. If not specified, it will default to the endpoint alias.

parameters.description: Named passed to the custom endpoint as model name. If not specified, it will default to the endpoint alias.

get.description: Returns a list of the available custom API keys.

schema.title: Response Get Custom Api Keys V0 Custom Api Key Get

put.description:
Stores a custom API key from a LLM provider in your account. This can be used in two ways:
1. As part of a custom endpoint. If you define a custom endpoint, you can reference a custom API
key. This will be sent to the endpoint as part of the request.
2. To use your own API keys in standard providers. If any of your custom API keys matches a provider
name and you pass `use_custom_keys=True` to the `/chat/completions` endpoint, this API key will
be used, charging your account directly instead of consuming Unify credits.

parameters.name: key

schema.description: Name of the API key.
schema.title: Key

parameters.description: Name of the API key.

parameters.name: value

schema.description: Value of the API key.
schema.title: Value

parameters.description: Value of the API key.

schema.title: Key

post.description:
Uses the named `eval` to begin an evaluation of quality scores for the selected LLM `endpoint`, on the given `dataset`.
You can upload custom scores (and bypass the LLM judge) by uploading a file via the `client_side_scores` argument.
Once the evaluation has finished, you can access the scores using the `evals/get_scores` endpoint.

parameters.name: eval_name

schema.description: Name of the eval to use.
schema.title: Eval Name

parameters.description: Name of the eval to use.

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Name of the uploaded dataset to evaluate.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Name of the uploaded dataset to evaluate.

parameters.name: endpoint

schema.description: Name of the endpoint to evaluate. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.
schema.title: Endpoint

parameters.description: Name of the endpoint to evaluate. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.

schema.title: Response Trigger Eval V0 Evals Trigger Post

example.info: Dataset evaluation started! You will receive an email soon!

example.detail: Invalid input. Couldn't find endpoints [model_1@endpoint_1, model_2@endpoint_2].

schema.description: Name of endpoint to fetch eval from. If not set returns evals for all endpoints

schema.description: If `True`, returns the scores on a per-prompt level. By default set to `False`. If `True` requires an eval name and endpoint to be set.
schema.title: Per Prompt

parameters.description: If `True`, returns the scores on a per-prompt level. By default set to `False`. If `True` requires an eval name and endpoint to be set.

post.description:
Trains a router based on a dataset and a set of endpoints. To use a
custom-trained router, you will need to deploy the resulting artifacts to
a live endpoint. To do this, use the `/router/deploy` POST endpoint.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the router.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the router.

parameters.name: dataset

schema.description: Name of the dataset to train the router on. To use a dataset, you need to first upload it to your account using the `/dataset` POST endpoints.
schema.title: Dataset

parameters.description: Name of the dataset to train the router on. To use a dataset, you need to first upload it to your account using the `/dataset` POST endpoints.

parameters.name: endpoints

schema.description: List of endpoints to include in the router. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.
schema.title: Endpoints

parameters.description: List of endpoints to include in the router. Endpoints must be specified using the `model@provider` format.

schema.title: Response Train Router V0 Router Train Post

example.info: Router training started! You will receive an email soon!

get.description:
Fetches a list of the trained routers and relevant metadata. These routers are training
artifacts and therefore don't imply an active, deployed router. To fetch a list of
deployed routers, you can use the /router/deploy/list GET endpoint.

schema.title: Response Get Trained Routers V0 Router Train List Get

post.description:
Deploys a trained router to a live endpoint.

To use this router, replace the model in the endpoint string with the
router name. E.g. you can use `router-abc` by calling the
`router-abc@q:1` endpoint.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the router to deploy.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the router to deploy.

schema.title: Response Deploy Router V0 Router Deploy Post

example.info: Router deployment started! You will receive an email soon!

example.detail: This router training doesn't exist. Please, choose a different one or trigger the training first.

delete.description: Deactivates and deletes a previously deployed router.

parameters.name: name

schema.description: Name of the router to un-deploy.
schema.title: Name

parameters.description: Name of the router to un-deploy.

schema.title: Response Delete Router V0 Router Deploy Delete

example.info: Router deletion started! You will receive an email soon!

get.description:
Fetches a list of the deployed routers and relevant metadata. These routers only
include deployed routers. To fetch a list of all trained routers,
you can use the /router/train/list GET endpoint.

To use any of these routers, replace the model in the endpoint string with the
router name. E.g. you can use `router-abc` with the endpoint `router-abc@q:1`.

schema.title: Response Get Deployed Routers V0 Router Deploy List Get

client_side_scores.title: Client Side Scores
client_side_scores.description: An optional file upload for client-side scores. The file must be in JSONL format and the prompts must match the order of the `dataset`. Each entry should include `prompt` and `score` keys, with `score` being a float between 0 and 1. The evaluation corresponding to the `eval_name` must have `client_side=True`.

ChatCompletionRequest.title: ChatCompletionRequest
ChatCompletionRequest.description:
Request model for chat completion based language model.

Attributes:
    model (str): The model identifier.
    messages (List[Dict[str]]): List of messages for completion.
    temperature (float): The temperature parameter for generating completions.
    stream (bool): Whether to stream the response.

ChatCompletionResponse.title: ChatCompletionResponse
ChatCompletionResponse.description:
Response model for chat completion based language model.

Attributes:
    model (str): The model identifier.
    created (int): Timestamp indicating when the response was created.
    id (str): Identifier for the completion response.
    object (str): The type of object, defaults to "chat.completion".
    usage (dict): Usage statistics or additional information.
    choices (List[Dict]): List of completion choices.

CreditsResponse.title: CreditsResponse
CreditsResponse.description:
Response model for credits models.

Attributes:
    id (str): The id of the users.
    credits (float): The credits of the users.

eval_name.title: Eval Name
eval_name.description: A unique, user-defined name used when referencing and triggering the eval.

system_prompt.title: System Prompt
system_prompt.description: An optional custom system prompt to provide specific instructions to the judge on how to score the answers.

class_config.title: Class Config
class_config.description:
If set, describes the list of classifications that the LLM judge uses to score each prompt. For example:
```
[{"label": "Excellent", "score": 1.0, "description": "A perfect answer with no factual mistakes"},
{"label": "Good", "score": 0.5, "description": "An average answer"},
{"label": "Bad", "score": 0.0, "description": "An incorrect answer, containing a significant factual mistake"}]
```

judge_models.title: Judge Models
judge_models.description: Specifies the LLM(s) to be used as the judge. This can be a string containining a single model name or a list of model names.

client_side.title: Client Side
client_side.description: Indicates whether evaluations are performed on the client-side. If `True`, the LLM judge is bypassed, and results are uploaded via the `trigger` endpoint.

InferenceRequest.title: InferenceRequest
InferenceRequest.description:
Request model for any model in the hub.
Attributes:
    model (str): The model identifier.
    provider (str): The provider identifier.
    arguments (Dict[str, Any]]): Model-specific arguments.
